revised_title: Structural Forms of Ice at Low Temperature and Pressure
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the structural forms of ice at low temperatures and pressures. They discovered three types of ice structures depending on the temperature: cubic, hexagonal, and vitreous ice. The researchers used X-ray diffraction to analyze the ice structures and found that the cubic form has unique properties, such as a different ratio of tetrahedral bonds compared to hexagonal ice. The study provides insights into the behavior of ice under various conditions and contributes to our understanding of its crystal structures.
